metadata.Title: CVE-2012-4511 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
services/flickr/flickr.c in libsocialweb before 0.25.21 automatically connects to Flickr when no Flickr account is set, which might allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a man-in-the-middle (MITM) attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4511` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-socialweb-client-0.25 - 0.25.20-3.1
libsocialweb-client2 - 0.25.20-3.1
libsocialweb-common - 0.25.20-3.1
libsocialweb-service - 0.25.20-3.1
libsocialweb0 - 0.25.20-3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsocialweb package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.25.20-3.1').
